content_1: . Officials from the Nepalese Department of Livestock Services confirmed three outbreaks of the highly pathogenic H5N1 avian influenza virus earlier this week. In the Narayani and Lumbini Zones, out of 1,675 birds, 410 died while 1,165 were destroyed to prevent further spread of the virus. The source of these outbreaks remains unknown. Various control measures being applied include stamping out, movement control, quarantine, and disinfection of contaminated areas.
header_2: H7N7 in Poultry in South Africa
content_2: . Officials from the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries recently reported three outbreaks of low pathogenic H7N7 on commercial ostrich farms in Oudtshoorn and George in the Western Cape Province of South Africa. Out of 9,047 birds, 3,012 were confirmed to have been infected with the virus. Various control measures being applied include quarantine, movement control, and screening.
